title.narrative: WILDAF Women political participation in Public affairs management 2016-2020

description.narrative: This project aims to increase the participation of women in decision-making bodies at all levels specially  in the three northern regions of Mali.Women from Timbuktu, Gao and Kidal, in addition to the difficult economic and security conditions in the area, are subject to socio-cultural constraints that significantly impact their participation in the  public  affairs management. After more than twenty years of democratic practice in Mali, the conclusion is clear: the political participation of women remains low. They are underrepresented in public and political lifes despite efforts  made in recent years by national NGOs  and development partners. This low representation of women which constitutes the majority of the population (over 51%) is a major failure of malian  democracy that actors Diakonia and its partenr WILDAF in collaboration of the government, civil society organisations want to find a definitive solution. That's why this project aims to increase the participation of women at all levels of democratic governance (local, national, regional) and in the process of national reconciliation in  Bamako disctrict , Timbuktu region (urban commune and Goundam) through strengthening the capacity of women, actors and allies, the pressure group, the  consultation frameworks between men and women, the support to the State and the Commission Truth Justice and Reconciliation for the implementation of the new action plan of 1325 in Mali.
This project mainly contributes to results within Fulfilment of women's rights. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
